lead_paragraph: Mr. Tillerson, nominated by President-elect Donald J. Trump to be secretary of state, has said America’s sources of oil should be “of little consequence to us.”

byline.contributor: Ben Hubbard reported from Beirut; Dionne Searcey from Dakar, Senegal; and Nicholas Casey from New York. Reporting was contributed by Clifford Krauss from Houston, Andrew E. Kramer from Moscow, and Chris Buckley and Jane Perlez from Beijing.
byline.original: By BEN HUBBARD, DIONNE SEARCEY and NICHOLAS CASEY

headline.print_headline: As Exxon Head, Tillerson Put Company’s Needs Over U.S. Interests
headline.main: Under Rex Tillerson, Exxon Mobil Forged Its Own Path Abroad

snippet: Mr. Tillerson, nominated by President-elect Donald J. Trump to be secretary of state, has said America’s sources of oil should be “of little consequence to us.”...
abstract: Rick Tillerson, Pres-elect Donald Trump's secretary of state nominee, has during his time as Exxon Mobile chief executive shown willingness to put company's interests ahead of United States; Tillerson's priorities are illustrated by his dealings in Iraq and Africa, calling into question his potential efficacy in Russia, where lifting of sanctions will benefit Exxon.
